docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign has hired Peter Daou, one of the most prominent political bloggers in the nation and the editor of U.N. Dispatch, which covers the United Nations. Mr. Daou, who directed blog outreach and online rapid response for the Kerry-Edwards campaign, has been recruited by the Clinton campaign to get its message into the blogosphere, which has not always been friendly to her, her political advisors say.
docs.abstract: Senator Clinton hires a blogger for her campaign

docs.lead_paragraph: I am an unapologetic, dyed-in-the-wool liberal who would sooner vote for Socks than for either Bob or Elizabeth Dole. While I have no sympathy for Dole's third and final lunge for the Presidency, the tragic irony of Mrs. Dole's situation is inescapable. I can't imagine a hotter spot in hell for this woman than her husband's current campaign. She outclasses him in every measure of a candidate and would, I believe, be a more agile, able challenger to Clinton in this election.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary E. Barnett, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Barnett of North Miami Beach, Fla., was married Friday in New York to Victor Bitar, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Georges Bitar of Beirut, Lebanon. Justice Stanley Ostrau of New York State Supreme Court officiated at the St. Regis. Mrs. Bitar, 30 years old, graduated from the Fashion Institute of Technology. She was until recently a buyer for Bergdorf Goodman in New York. Her father, who is retired, was an executive sales manager for the Equitable Bag Company, a shopping-bag manufacturer in New York.
